description.description:
Inspired by the adventure and imagination that we love from classic science-fiction, No Man's Sky presents you with a galaxy to explore, filled with unique planets and lifeforms, and constant danger and action.

In No Man's Sky, every star is the light of a distant sun, each orbited by planets filled with life, and you can go to any of them you choose. Fly smoothly from deep space to planetary surfaces, with no loading screens, and no limits. In this infinite procedurally generated universe, you'll discover places and creatures that no other players have seen before - and perhaps never will again.

No Man's Sky, developed by Hello Games, was released in August 2016 after a highly anticipated marketing campaign that promised a groundbreaking, procedurally generated universe filled with exploration and discovery. The game's promotion created high expectations among gamers. However, at launch, the game faced significant criticism for missing key features that had been hinted at or promised during its development. Many players felt the game did not live up to its initial promises, leading to backlash and a wave of refund requests.

Over time, however, Hello Games released multiple updates that addressed many of the criticisms, adding key features, which improved the game's reception. Today, No Man's Sky is often regarded as a success story of post-launch support and redemption in the gaming industry.

这算是我最近几年时长超100小时但最后不推荐的游戏。

上个月买的时候是出于回顾了纪录片"行星"对于冥王星的探索，那种遥远宇宙未知的探索让人感到震撼，所以就买了无人深空，开始的30小时确实让人觉得非常惊喜，各种各样建筑、多功能武器、代步工具、飞船、货船，样样耳目一新，对深空探索有很多的期待。

但30小时后发现，这个宇宙世界是相当乏味，无限多的星球都只是多素材的随机排列组合，探索深度很浅、4类星系、3个种族空间站、10类往下的星球气候、元素周期表1/2不到的元素（更别说合成物）、弱功能的建筑系统（还有物品消失bug)、拉拉队的空战系统、可有可无的舰队挂机、完全跑图的主线........我真的想象不到初版是多么的差，然后受害者们经历了多年的更新会给游戏开发商好评......我只能说这种好评是出于对持续更新的毅力的认可，但游戏问题仍然很大，8年的更新也解决不了游戏大框架的问题。

说说游戏关于星空制作，其实直接用常识就知道，手工做会比批量重复有价值，不然要人工来干嘛，程序随机排列组合N个星球是不如老老实实手工做出有限个星球组成的一个星系，或有限个星系，这个观点在星际拓荒最有说服力，有限个星球但极富想象的星际探索感，这种体验是在玩家能感受到制作者的用心，而不是体验好不好就让上帝的随机种子来安排，那评价就肯定是褒贬不一，五十五十。由于底层是随机的程序化生成，导致主线、支线模块化十分严重，割裂感很强，也导致采用碎片化的剧情，还得重复跑N个随机但千篇一律的星系。

实在太多无效内容、太浅的世界理解，导致出这样的作品，别再搞这种大框架少内容的游戏，有效内容都被稀释得玩不下去，正如不看好公式化开放世界一样，程序化生成式世界不会是一个好的方向，玩家终归是喜欢"有人味"的深空。

（100多小时，大部分时间是在探索如何刷模块与刷钱，但当完成全元素矿场、核爆休眠装置（最贵交易品）单日双10件产出，日赚3亿的产业链，发现钱其实用不了多少，因为佣兵公会刷护卫就满级能免费拿多功能扩展模块、探险家公会靠套装导航图跟深渊核心就能满级，免费获得护卫舰回收模块、商人公会用100个回收技术装置就能满级获得飞船扩展模块，之后两个星际相互传送就能无限刷，网上什么买飞船拆飞船刷模块都是浪费时间，游戏最花钱的升级部分直接无脑解决，纳米星币多个海盗星系来回花钱开可疑技术，随便上万星币，剩下的是异常乏味，并想赶紧完成游戏主线并删游戏，我不想再去刷什么乐土、建房子拍照，随机+枯燥已经很要命，100小时的游戏已经对这游戏最大的游玩诚意。）

Desde seu lançamento, No Man's Sky passou por uma transformação espetacular. A Hello Games conseguiu pegar o que era inicialmente um jogo promissor e o expandiu em algo absolutamente grandioso, elevando a experiência a níveis incríveis. O universo é vasto, praticamente infinito, e cada planeta que você visita parece único, repleto de paisagens deslumbrantes e vida selvagem fascinante. As atualizações constantes são um verdadeiro presente, adicionando novos recursos que constantemente mantêm o jogo fresco e emocionante.

Seja você um explorador solitário ou alguém que gosta de jogar com amigos, o jogo oferece uma gama diversificada de atividades: desde construir bases elaboradas em planetas exóticos, até combater em batalhas espaciais épicas. A liberdade que No Man's Sky oferece é incomparável. É fácil se perder por horas, mergulhando nas profundezas do espaço, descobrindo sistemas solares e civilizações alienígenas.

Graficamente, o jogo é deslumbrante, e a trilha sonora é imersiva, criando uma atmosfera perfeita para a exploração. O compromisso da desenvolvedora com os jogadores, através de atualizações robustas e melhorias contínuas, é admirável e raro na indústria.

Em resumo, No Man's Sky não é apenas um jogo, é uma experiência única que continua a surpreender e encantar. Se você ainda não experimentou, está perdendo um dos maiores e mais ambiciosos jogos de exploração espacial da atualidade.

I started playing No Man's Sky in 2022, and by the time I jumped in, the game was already in a fantastic place. While I'd heard about the rocky launch back in 2016, what I experienced felt like a completely different game—one that had clearly evolved with time and care. The sheer scope of the universe, the depth of gameplay, and the attention to detail blew me away from the start.

The thing that really stands out for me is how much the developers, Hello Games, continue to support the game with heavy updates. Even though I began playing several years after release, it felt like the game was still fresh. Every few months, they roll out major updates that aren't just small tweaks or bug fixes but massive content drops that add entirely new dimensions to the game. In my time playing, I've seen new features like settlement building, more advanced base-building tools, new storylines, living ships, and even massive starships to command.

These updates don't just expand the content—they give me new reasons to explore. Every time a big update drops, I feel like I need to revisit planets I've already seen, or venture out to completely uncharted star systems, just to experience the new features. Whether it's underwater exploration, the chance to manage my own alien settlement, or new multiplayer options, the developers have made sure that the game never grows stale.

What makes *No Man's Sky* so impressive is that it's never really finished. Even when I think I've seen all there is to see, a new update comes along and completely changes the way I interact with the universe. The sense of discovery never fades because Hello Games keeps adding layers of depth to the game. Whether it's new biomes, alien species, or mechanics like settlement management and building giant freighters, it's always evolving.

It's rare to see a game get this much post-launch support, and it's clear the devs are passionate about keeping No Man's Sky up-to-date, not just with fixes, but with entirely new experiences.

负面评价：
1. 首发问题：游戏在首发时存在许多问题，包括性能问题、功能缺失和与宣传不符的内容，这导致了许多玩家的失望和负面评价。

总结：
《无人深空》是一款具有创新精神和宏伟愿景的游戏，它成功地创造了一个充满无限探索可能性的宇宙。尽管游戏在首发时遭遇了重大挫折，但通过不断的更新和改进，游戏逐渐赢得了玩家的认可和好评。对于喜欢太空探索和自由游戏的玩家来说，这是一款值得尝试的作品。然而，它的重复性和初期的问题可能会让一些玩家望而却步。

I don't write reviews very often, but I feel like at this point I have to. No Man's Sky is an extraordinary game, and it's gone a very long way. I had a chance to try it not long after release, and even though NMS was beautiful back then, it felt very convoluted and the UI didn't want to cooperate at all, so I had to put it aside.

I decided to purchase it a little less than a year ago, and I haven't regretted it one bit. It gave me back the full value of my money and a lot more fun on top of that. The advantages of No Man's Sky are many:

• Beautiful environments, stunning FX, music and weather/water visuals
• A touching main quest line, it sticks with you for a long time unless you're bothered by lack of dialogue
• Many activities to choose from, such as seeking upgrades, farming, base building, questing, improving or ruining faction relations, piracy, mercenary work, ship hunting, pet hunting etc.
• A meaningful long-term progression system with the upgrades and customisations available for your multitool, exosuit, exocraft (multiple of them, although the Minotaur is my favourite) starship, freighter and even your fleet
• Procedural generation, while might be a disadvantage if implemented incorrectly, truly makes this game shine
• Ship combat is fun
• Content updates and new expeditions are still being rolled out after all these years.

The possible disadvantages I can think of are:

• The aforementioned lack of voiced dialogue. I think it's perfect for a game like this, but some players might not enjoy it
• The main quest can be a little convoluted to complete. I would also advise not to try to do it in a group, you might get some bugs
• If you are looking for a game to "complete", this isn't it. No Man's Sky is endless outside of the mian quest
• There are some bugs to be aware of, such as your ship not properly docking at the Anomaly or being stuck in someone's freighter in multiplayer. Nothing game-breaking, but might be annoying
• The ground combat is a bit less fun than ship combat. It's nice when you get used to it, but some more options to handle combat scenarios and new weapons would be great
• The planets, while beautiful, might feel shallow to some players, because the landmarks are few and far between at times. This is one area of the game I'd really like to see some improvements for, I'm hoping we'll see some new landmarks and ruins in Worlds part 2.

All in all, I love No Man's Sky. It's my comfort game I see myself coming back to for many years to come. I wholeheartedly recommend you try it if you enjoy space and exploration.

В игре огромный выбор звездолетов разных классов, но это толком ни на что не влияет так как все космические бои даже на сложности «выживание» являются просто тиром. А все противники – это одинаковые пираты да перехватчики стражей. Последние просто чуть толще пиратов. Пострелушки на своих двоих тоже не блещут разнообразием. В игре даже нет гуманоидных противников при наличии тех же пиратов. Ты можешь сражаться со стражами... коих опять же всего 6 видов! Есть еще пара видов corrupted стражей и пара видов космических жуков. И это при том, что выбор оружия для мултитула и апгрейдов к нему довольно неплохой, но все это опять же не имеет смысла! Почему? Да потому что никто из этих противников не представляет угрозы даже на той же сложности «выживание», как и в случае с космическими боями. Я пробегал десятки часов с дерьмовым мультитулом класса B, который взял чисто из-за количества ячеек под технологии, с установленным самым базовым типом вооружения, и у меня не было проблем ни с какими противниками. Этого хватало чтобы разбирать все волны стражей особо не напрягаясь.

В игре есть транспорт и можно даже покататься и посражаться на огромном роботе. Но в этом нет смысла, так как в игре НЕТ врагов, которые могут тебя вынудить сесть в этого робота.

В игре можно обзавестись огромным фрейтером или пиратским дредноутом. И когда ты впервые видишь этот дредноут, который напал на гражданский фрейтер, огромные пушки, фригаты выпускающие торпеды, бой эскадрилий истребителей, ты думаешь: «Вот оно!» И это единственное событие в игре, где ты это увидишь. Даже получив в свое распоряжение фрейтер или дредноут, он будет всего лишь мобильной базой. И даже с этим разработчики накосячили, так как подразумевается, что после получения такого корабля ты между системами будешь прыгать уже на нем, так как дальность варп-прыжков у него больше, чем у личного корабля. Но если ты будешь прыгать на нем, то игра не будет генерировать событий защиты тех же гражданских фрейторов, за которые ты получаешь апгрейды для своего. Т.е. если ты хочешь прокачивать свой фрейтер, то ты ни в коем случае не должен использовать его для прыжков между системами. Это бред! Ты даже можешь нанять целый флот из 30 фригатов и эскадрилью истребителей, но фригаты можно только отправлять на миссии за ресурсами, а истребители скорее мешаются во время боя, чем помогают. Они просто не наносят урона и единственная их задача – отвлекать на себя часть противников. Но из-за постоянного мельтешения ты боишься сам по ним попасть, особенно если у тебя установлены достаточно мощные пушки. А дредноут? Когда ты призываешь его с поверхности планеты на орбиту, он собой закрывает пол неба. То, что ты можешь на своем корыте влезть в разборки двух кораблей capital-класса и уничтожить или заставить капитулировать такой корабль – просто верх абсурда! Но то, что все его пушки и турели являются просто декорацией – по-настоящему обидно. Ты даже можешь его призвать во время боя с теми же пиратами, и он не будет ничего делать. Просто висеть в качестве бэкграунда.

В игре есть исследования заброшенных в космосе фрейтеров, с которых тоже можно получить апгрейды для своего, и когда ты попадаешь на такой фрейтер первый раз – это нечто! Заброшенные отсеки и коридоры подсвеченные фонариком, жутковатое звуковое сопровождение, разбросанные тут и там планшеты членов команды с логами, говорящие о том, что тут произошло что-то ужасное. И тут ты слышишь какой-то пронзительный скрип или еще какой-то звук, спиной вжимаешься в ближайший угол, судорожно крутя дулом мультитула, ожидая не то какого-нибудь ксеноморфа, который выползет из вентиляции, не то терминатора, который выйдет из коридора, не то вообще какую-нибудь непонятную космическую ктулховщину. Но ничего не происходит! И скоро ты понимаешь, что шикарное и атмосферное звуковое сопровождение является всего лишь звуковым сопровождением. А на втором или третьем таком фрейтере ты поймешь, что все противники, которых ты на них встретишь – это безобидные турели и бесячие космические тараканы. И все! А на десятом ты уже наизусть знаешь все типы отсеков, из которых эти фрейтеры состоят. Я не понимаю, как с такими шикарными декорациям и атмосферой заброшенного корабля словно сошедшего с экранов космических ужастиков можно было так облажаться с наполнением! Сколько можно было придумать там интересных сценариев! Но нет... вот тебе турели и космические тараканы.

В игре есть кулинария... которая ни на что не влияет, так как тут нет системы голода и приготовленные блюда не дают никаких эффектов. В игре есть рыбалка, садоводство, даже собственную ферму можно организовать, и все это... да... ни на что не влияет. Ты тут можешь даже стать куратором собственного поселения и заниматься его менеджментом, но это поселение существует, как тот сферический конь в вакууме, и никак не влияет на игру. Ты можешь даже вогнать его в долги, и тебе никогда не придется эти долги выплачивать.

И я даже не хочу говорить про огромное количество разных эксплоитов в игре, некоторые из которых существуют чуть ли не с релиза, и никто до сих пор не озаботился тем, чтобы их исправить. Например, сохранение и перезагрузка полностью обновляют ассортимент торговцев, что в свою очередь позволяет покупать бесконечное количество каких-то редких модулей или товаров, сбрасывать и снова делать доступными РАЗОВЫЕ награды представителей гильдий, респавнит некоторые редкие ресутры и т.д. Есть абсурдные эксплоиты типа нанитов, которые ты можешь делать из воздуха, просто прокачав репутацию с какой-то расой до максимума. Это делается очень легко и дает тебе 50% скидку в магазинах, после чего ты можешь скупать модули технологий и тут же продавать их обратно дороже, чем ты их купил. А с эксплоитом перезагрузок это можно делать бесконечно. Почему разработчики до сих пор не пофиксили подобные очевидные косяки для меня загадка. И это я только пару примеров привел. Тут их полно!

Но самая большая раковая опухоль игры на мой взгляд – система порталов. Дело в том, что игрок, найдя, например, какой-нибудь крутой корабль может пойти на реддит и выложить код для портала системы и координаты, и любой другой игрок может спокойно воспользоваться этими координатами, чтобы получить такой же точно корабль. Кому-то может показаться, что это, наоборот, плюс, а не минус, но весь смысл игры в исследовании Вселенной и нахождении чего-то интересного. Кто-то скажет, что можно же и не пользоваться этой возможностью, если ты не хочешь. И это правда, но стоит открыть любой видео-гайд для новичков по игре, и ты увидишь, как тебе сначала покажут как с помощью каких-нибудь эксплоитов нафармить кучу денег, потом кучу нанитов, потом как собрать все глифы для портала, а потом вот тебе координаты убер-корабля и убер-мультитула. Все, ты готов играть в No Man's Sky! И возникает только один вопрос: «А зачем играть дальше?» У тебя уже все есть. Пройти сюжетку? Так она является по сути растянутым туториалом, где тебя постепенно учат взаимодействовать с разными механиками игры, типа тех же порталов. Какой смысл что-то искать, исследовать системы если за тебя уже все нашли?

Если вы хотите получить удовольствие от игры, то не смотрите никаких гайдов, не пользуйтесь эксплоитами, и Боже вас упаси от использования порталов для получения каких-нибудь кораблей или мультитулов. Просто играйте! В этом случае игра вполне способна затянуть на пару сотен часов. Только играйте на сложности «выживание», ибо нормальная сложность совсем унылая.

No Man's Sky is exactly what I expected Starfield to be (I refunded Starfield and bought this on discount for half the price). It's packed with interesting, explorable planets, each offering a unique experience. One of the standout features is the freedom to build your own base and do whatever you like. The sense of exploration is real, and you're never tied down to a single objective.

Loading screens are practically non-existent unless you're switching between solar systems, which keeps the gameplay immersive. The smooth transition from planet surfaces to space enhances the feeling of being part of a vast, interconnected universe.

One of the pleasant surprises in No Man's Sky is how it functions like a hybrid MMO. There are plenty of players online, but they don't interfere with your experience unless you choose to interact with them. This makes multiplayer feel truly optional, ideal for both solo adventurers and those wanting to team up with friends.

A major highlight is the fact that the game is still receiving updates for free. Considering the wealth of content and improvements the developers continue to offer, it's a steal if you enjoy exploring space and flying around galaxies.

At its core, this is what Minecraft in space should feel like. It looks good, plays decently, and delivers the open-world freedom many have been craving in a space exploration game.

The only real issue I've encountered is the presence of bugs, which are fairly common, though they usually aren't major. Another personal gripe is the lack of full automation. When I play sandbox games, I like to eventually reach a point where I can farm resources automatically, and No Man's Sky doesn't quite deliver on that front. But I understand that's more of a "me" problem.

Maybe now is a great time, after the many recent updates (and with more coming), for you to start your own space odyssey. If you're into this type of game, I believe you won't regret it.

It's... fine.
Exploration, combat, base building, ships and other vehicles, upgrading stuff, now even fishing.. It's all in various levels from okay to good, and the only really impressive thing is the scale.
Don't get me wrong, it's still pretty fun - the first time you get thrown in the air by a random tornado, witnessing all sorts of different environment and animals, finding something really unique or ridiculous ( found a planet where the only animal looked like a blue balloon that's bleeding from the bottom and sounds like it's constantly screaming), getting trough the main storyline and learning the lore, building and outfitting a base...

And it still lacks cohesiveness, polish, and quality of life features.
I mean, you can almost tell what the different expansions/updates were. On planets surface most flora and fauna are nice and random, but just go into the cave and you'll find the same 3-4 stalagmite/stalactite types, 5 or so flower types, and maybe some other minerals that you find occasionally, and of course they are recoloured on different planets, but they're still the same. Go underwater and you'll also find that while generation is still quite random, but the repertoire is very limited and tends to look almost the same, not to mention when generation likes to screw up and generates a land animal to be one of the usual 3 fish type creatures you find in water.
Then there's the thing with revisiting the same places - the environment changes seem to stick, but go into the same random building and the containers are sometimes open, other times not, the door that you broke might or might not be there, and you might or might not get stuff from the same thing you opened or used before. The crashed ships that you can find, repair and then salvage, seem to reappear if you go to another system and then back, so you can just exploit that for easy and fast money.
For polish, there is just so much little stuff, like all kinds of UI weirdness or inconsistency. Lot's of different interfaces, and the scroll wheel works only in some of them, and in some it works differently than in others. Or that sound and other things in setting are not sliders, but click an arrow and wait for accelerating changing number, or just click a bunch of times.
And then there is QOL features. I get that there is no map and can live with that, but how after all this time there is no simple waypoint that you can put on the planet to find something later is just baffling to me. There are substitutes that you can use, but all of them have some limitations and most can't be renamed, so people tend to use bases for that, which just looks stupid.
That time i got softlocked in a main story quest and had to look up guides on how to fix it by modifying game files also did not earn any points from me.
The navigation is also just not great. While outside the planet with your ship, there ar 3 different UI systems for navigation, but even using all of them is barely enough, and two of them even clash with each other making it harder to use. And if you try to go on an expedition, good luck finding stuff, the amount of icons for other players, their bases and safepoints makes it almost unusable.

And yet with these flaws and others, I still played for 100+ hours and did quite enjoy it. While It is a great feat that Hello Games did making something out of a disaster that was the launch version of this game, it still feels like a patchwork job and no amount of hyping it up is gonna change that. But if you know what you're getting into, there is definitely stuff to enjoy here, so i'm still recommending it.

And here's hoping that their next game is even better.

I won't go on about the redemption arc, everyone has already done that to death. The game has very much redeemed itself, yes, but there's a catch. While there is an absolute metric ton of new stuff to do and find and fly and such, the core gameplay loop hasn't really been touched all that much. Don't get me wrong, the game is really, really great and I absolutely do enjoy playing it, but it could really go for some overhauls to some of the core mechanics, such as how horribly the game's movement controls are.

From a design standpoint, and of course my personal opinion, the way the movement is designed very much warrants a change. Jumping feels unpredictable, the jetpack feels clumsy, and sprinting feels... I don't know it just feels a bit bland and clumsy at times as well. It's one of the very few things that still hasn't been touched. The same goes for weaponry. You just aim, shoot, and watch a healthbar go down. Be that your own, or the enemy's. The aiming system is also just shallow and the ship doesn't really feel different. A lot of the time I notice that I'm just trying to slooowly fight my turning radius to get my enemy back in my sights because they keep zooming past me and behind me, good strategy but infuriating to play against. And it doesn't have the nuance of a game like Elite Dangerous, something this game's flight model I believe is directly modeled after. In ED, you can for example if you want to keep your momentum, turn flight assist off and turn around all the while free floating, or slow down on purpose to get in a blue throttle zone where speed to turn ratio is the absolute best. NMS doesn't have many of these systems which makes ship fighting similarly frustrating at times. In ED I've many times successfully managed to tailgate ships during fights yet in NMS I've never managed to do anything similar even once.

Again, the game is great and is much more than they originally promised which is why I will absolutely still recommend it. The story is absolutely right up my alley as well and all in all there is no other game like this one, but I think it's about time to follow through to the end with all the overhauls and stop trying to improve the way grass looks and instead focus on the legs and arms of the player character.

再说模块部分，众所周知，工具/背包格子在这类游戏中非常重要，尤其是前期常常面临背包已满的情况，而你知道无人深空里，在不开修改器和卡BUG的情况下，最快的获取方案吗？没错，还是公会，就刷纳米星团的时候顺手拿了，就飞船/货船/多功能用途工具/背包格子，一次一个，这不比你累死累活给空间站做任务来的快？但是这有意思吗？
你可能会反驳说要有游戏体验就老老实实做任务，别整天想着刷物资，首先既然我没开挂没卡BUG正常游戏，为什么就没有游戏体验了，这不值得制作组反思一下游戏平衡吗？其次，就算是做任务到后面也全都重复了，你对着全部一样的任务做上几百个小时更没游戏体验。最后，你可能还好好的做着任务被BUG恶心，我有一次运送货物结果接收货物的终端卡没了，只能放弃任务还要被扣除声望值。
还有重要材料部分，不少重要材料都是平时看着没用，用的时候没有的，就科尔瓦克斯方箱，谁会知道S级别翻译器突然问你要这种东西，还有那个维吉恩匕首，也是我刚刚卖完，然后任务问我要两个，没办法快速获取就卡着了呗。
还有合成数树部分，在这个游戏中，金是绝对不缺的，银是偶尔缺的，铜是经常缺的，按照教程，玩家会用二份铜精炼一份有色金属，而正确做法是1份金1份银1份铜精炼5份有色金属，铜的效率相差十倍，就主打一个信息差，专门坑新人。问题是坑就坑了，还不给个合成表，每次精炼的时候还带去Wiki查查免得被坑。
另外就是范围加载的特性，首先是开飞船的时候地面大部分矿石都没了，或者要很近才能看到，对于飞船炸矿很不友好；其次是范围加载速度超级慢，经常把玩家卡在奇怪的地方（有一次直接把我从家里卡出去了，还有一次给我卡到危险植物群系里差点死了），最后是那个屋子，由于判定出问题了我的超级大基地四面漏风，在房子里都能冻得扣血。
还有就是各种奇怪的穿模，卡位BUG，虽然大部分不影响平衡但是每天都要见好多，比如我货船上的NPC把腿卡到地面里面了，或者某个受损的金属箱卡在了自噬体NPC头上面，最逆天的是废弃建筑可以穿模进二楼，在降落时把飞船一部分卡入废弃建筑，下飞船自动就给你卡到二楼了。
再说说护卫舰，生物护卫舰全方面吊打普通护卫舰，理由是生物护卫舰在获得时就可以S级，拥有极高基础属性，还能通过喂食洗刷词条，可以算作游戏的终极护卫舰，而刷生物护卫舰时间极长，就算物资备齐平均一个小时搞不到几艘，跟别说像我这样的非酋还有一个小时一艘的蜗牛速度成绩。就你重复一个30s的动作刷一个小时还是很难被接受的吧。
再说殖民地（定居点）任务和护卫舰远征，每个步骤都要让你强制等好几个小时（除非开挂），很难想象这中页游机制会出现在一个steam上的买断制单机游戏上。
还有那个赛季远征，你单机游戏做什么赛季呢，合着我要想玩到历史全部内容还要一直等复刻，这不是氪金手游才用的套路吗？HG真是为了日活脸都不要了。
但是局限于单机游戏，你不舒服了就能开挂能卡BUG，还可以修改存档，但是这些东西为啥不是HG去做，或者至少把平衡性改好而非逼着玩家开挂卡BUG。

I got this game on a sale for like 30 bucks in 2024 and I feel absolutely spoiled by this purchase. The amount of content  and exploration and crafting is breathtaking, yet really relaxing at the same time. You can really feel the 8 YEARS OF CONSTANT UPDATES that went into this game. My 100+ hours was all single player, I haven't bothered with any multiplayer stuff yet (apparently there's a lot of it).

Pros:
- If you like exploration games this really scratches the itch
- If you like sci-fi games, same thing
- If you like crafting, same thing
- If you like base building, same thing
- If you like survival games, ditto.
- If you like trading games, also, that's here (though kinda bare bones)
- Fishing is pretty fun

Cons:
- The UI is too minimal and really hurts the experience at first and feels more like it's concealing functionality rather than revealing it
- Some missions (very few) are time locked, start a mission, do a few things, come back in 24 hours to be able to do the next step
- Some content you're just locked out of permanently if you weren't around for when the expedition (periodic launching of new features) happened, kind of like what some MMOs do. But a lot of this can be remedied with modding, I'm told.
- Combat for the most part is un-challenging and hard to come by (I haven't tried PVP and have only been playing on classic and expedition there's other modes and options to fiddle with that allow more and and harder combat).
- The lack of a working map system (just follow the icons in your hud)
- The inventory sorting options are weak and barely useful. Try finding an item in 200 slots spread over a suit, a ship and a freighter - *Plz Give us more options or even to put in letters to find stuff.
- The lack of a strong story (but this is kind of made up for by constantly revealing more lore through exploring and no one cares what Minecraft is about, etc.)

To wit, all of my pros are serious endorsement and all the cons are just style critiques. There's also a rather large and dedicated community on youtube for explaining some of the finer points of the systems in the game.

If you're looking for a new game you should buy this. If it's on sale, you should definitely buy it.

No Man's Sky is a true masterpiece that creates an entirely shapeable universe (or universes) that we can never fully explore. The ability to code such a vast world that can run even on lower-end systems is truly commendable. With endless planets to discover, various biomes, and intriguing life forms, players are constantly drawn into new adventures. However, it must be acknowledged that after a while, the game can become somewhat repetitive and its difficulty may diminish; this can reduce its appeal for some players.

Nonetheless, the experience it offers is quite satisfying. The continuous updates and new mechanics keep the game feeling fresh. The developers seem to be aware of this, as they frequently enrich the game with free updates and Expeditions events. These events provide new goals for players, keeping the spirit of exploration alive.

The game isn't just about exploration; it also incorporates building and survival elements. Activities like constructing bases, managing resources, and upgrading ships provide players with a deep experience. When considering the price-to-performance ratio, No Man's Sky is definitely a game worth considering. It's a fantastic choice for anyone looking to lose themselves in a vast universe and write their own story!

TL;DR: Worth it as of 2024 especially for people who like exploration-heavy games. It's a slow burn, a game where your curiosity and creativity along with the interesting galaxies, systems, and planets dictate your motivation to play. It may be overwhelming at first, but there are plenty of reddit posts should you have questions the game doesn't answer.

Table of contents
I. Gameplay
II. Multiplayer/Community
III. Story (no spoilers)
IV. Graphics
V. Support

I. Gameplay
Core gameplay is scanning planets, landing on them if they have materials/buildings you need, and moving to the next need. These needs arise from core questlines, and the game will point you wherever you need to go next. It may seem stressful at first, but basically every planet should provide you with what you need to live and leave. There are also endless planets to explore, and the rocks, plants, and animals on each planet are randomly generated to be discovered/scanned by the first person to find them. You can rename all of these and even the planets if you are the first one to discover them. You'll likewise find planets and discoveries that have been renamed by other people. If you're like me, you'd want to surround yourself with things with your name on them so that would drive you to find your own system and planet.
Ground movement is basic, flying is easy, and you can just melee+jump through the world quickly. Ground combat is basic and easy though shuffling through weapons is a bit different from most games. Also be aware that in 3rd person, your vertical sensitivity is locked to a percentage lower than your horizontal sensitivity and you cannot change it (I recommend 1st person only for combat). Spaceship control is easy and very intuitive (I recommend 1st person). Spaceship combat is also basic and easy since the game aims for you.
Building is comparable to your generic survival game building with square/triangle floors, roofs, and auto-locking. Crafting essentials and stations are easy to build and you only need 1 (you can always teleport as long as there's a space station, and most systems have one). Cosmetics are nice but I haven't delved into them to have a strong opinion.
Much of the gameplay comes from self-motivated exploration: looking for the perfect planet to set up a base on or looking for the right ship design to reset for. You can even opt to learn languages (which I did) instead of using translator upgrades, but it's slow and tedious.

II. Multiplayer
Multiplayer is a bit iffy and I mostly wouldn't recommend NMS as a multiplayer game. You will connect in and out of sessions, and some events/enemies may trigger for a person and not another person in the same vicinity. If you want to link up with a friend though, you have to find a portal and go to the glyph coordinates of your friend.
The overall community for the game is great though. If you have any questions, people have probably already asked and answered them on reddit. There have been very few instances of recorded griefing, and the many planets, systems, and galaxies make it very hard to find other people anyway.

III. Story (no spoilers)
The story is a bit deep and I haven't really cared too much for it, but I can say that it is coherent and might be interesting to some people. It fundamentally revolves around you as a Traveller not knowing anything and then being tossed into a world with other Travellers that are at various points in their journey and unravel the truth about Travellers and the world itself. That's just a very generalized breakdown of the "main" questline, but there are other quests that tie into and add to the Traveller's background. There are also tons of tidbits of lore you can go find if you're interested, and on the flipside you can enjoy the game without paying attention to the story at all.

IV. Graphics
The graphics are good, nothing super realistic and not groundbreaking at all. Just be aware that it is a graphically intensive game and for some reason DLSS is way worse than FSR in this game (at least for me and some self-affirming posts I found). Do what you gotta to make it work for you.

V. Support
The game is a labor of love. It started rough, fixed most of its problems, and added a ton of content for no charge at all. The game also goes on sale (24 USD when I bought it) just before big expedition updates drop, so the game is well worth its sale price. I expect the studio's next game Light No Fire to be a solid reflection of the lessons learned from NMS.

Одним из основных аспектов игры является исследование новых миров и открытие удивительных существ. Каждая планета уникальна и ожидает вас с новыми вызовами и возможностями.

Единственное, после чего я перестала играть, это после того как я закончила основной сюжет, смысл в игре был потерян. Хотя эту игру можно проходить и без какого-либо сюжета, просто исследовать мир, улучшать базу и свои снаряжения.

А так игра супер и я ее рекомендую, так как это одна из немногих игр, которые меня по настоящему впечатлили!

No Man's Sky es simplemente impresionante. Después de tantas horas, sigo encontrando cosas nuevas que me sorprenden. Tengo mi base en un planeta que elegí tras explorar varios sistemas, con una colección de naves que he ido perfeccionando con el tiempo y un carguero que hace que mis expediciones sean más emocionantes.

Lo mejor de todo es cómo sigue mejorando con cada actualización. Cada vez que vuelvo, hay algo nuevo que explorar o mejorar. Los desarrolladores realmente han sabido escuchar a la comunidad y convertir el juego en algo que supera las expectativas originales.

Si te gustan los juegos de exploración y construcción, este es uno de los mejores. Siempre hay algo que hacer, algún rincón del universo que descubrir.

No Man's Sky no deja de sorprenderme, y no puedo esperar para ver qué será lo próximo.
